1�What can I help you with?Nothing.Performance assessment.New Allied Tags.Temporary items.Union registration.Teleportation.Information on the Allied Campaign.
1�You've already undergone an evaluation for this battle, or had you forgotten?As much as I'd like to, I'm forbidden from providing you with a new set of Allied Taegs until the next battle begins.

�!�I am sorry,  , but your campaign medal has expired. I cannot issue tags to anyone not authorized by the Allied Forces. Return to your nation's capital and speak with a Campaign Evaluation Official.

1�Register for a union?No.Yes.
1�What will you do?Nothing.Transfer to another union.Resign union membership.

1�Your steadfast efforts have earned you a claim to share in your union's spoils of war.By  �[transferring to another union/resigning from your union], you will relinquish this right.It is not my place to question your decision, but I suggest you pay the matter due heed.

1�I am afraid that all unions are currently at their maximum enrollment, and unable to accept new recruits.For better or for worse, though, I suspect it shall not be long before we are in need of some new blood.Such is the nature of war...

1�Hey, you're in the way.We fortifyin' this here wall to withstand the beastmen's siege turrets.So how's about just gettin' outta here before you get hurt.
1�Unless you're willin' to wipe that helpless look off your face and lend us a hand.That'd be a different story.

1�Unless you're willin' to wipe that helpless look off your face and lend us a hand.That'd be a different story.
1�Assist with the fortifications?Show them how it's done!Refuse to help.Ask for an explanation.
1�Alright! That's the spirit!Let's get a move on, then.
1�Alright! That's the spirit!Let's get a move on, then.
1�Alright! That's the spirit!Let's get a move on, then.

1�Like I said, in preparation for an enemy assault, we're workin' to fortify these defensive barriers.If you're willin', I'd like to place you in charge of managin' these here craftsmen as they go about it.

1�To be more precise, once you get to each craftsman's position, you have to tell 'em exactly what I'm about to tell you.Namely, what type of crystal they need to be usin'. That's all there is to it.
1�The young Elvaan wearin' the red hat is a blacksmith.Make sure he's using fire crystals.
1�The adorable little Tarutaru with the blonde braids is laying plaster.Gonna have to get her on some ice crystals.
1�The Hume lady is a stonemason, and a darn good one.She's gonna be needin' wind crystals.
1�That old coot of an Elvaan with the huge axe strapped across his back is a carpenter.Famous 'round these parts. Make sure you get him workin' with earth crystals.
1�May not look it, but the Mithra with the black kerchief wrapped 'round her noggin is an architect.She's gonna need her lightning crystals.
1�That sprat of a Tarutaru wearin' the blue getup's a handy lil' plumber.Surin' he'll be wantin' his water crystals, no doubt.
1�The good-looking fella in all white does scaffoldin'. Young Hume lad.See to it he's usin' light crystals.
1�The lady Elvaan's a painter. Handles a brush like nobody I never seen.Need dark crystals in that line of work.And that's it.
1�Ahhh, one more thing.If you're too late issuin' your orders, they're liable to up and leave their posts.So be right, and be quick.

1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, �[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.
1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Beneath the Mask.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Survey of the Quadav perimeter complete, Sergeant Rainer, sir!Movements of one hundred shellback scouts observed and recorded as ordered, sir!
1�Yeah, yeah...took yer sweet time, didn't ya, maggots!?Well? Hand 'em over! And there better not be a single page out of place!
1�Y-yes sir!
1�One, two--you expect me to read these chocobo scratches!?--three, four--bah, I've seen better quillmanship from a goobbue!--five...
1�...Eighty-eight, eighty-nine. What are ya, deaf and stupid?I said a hundred! Get back out there, Jackals!
1�Whaaat!? But you didn't even count them all!

1�You got a problem, slugs!? Then make it two hundred...sorted by shell color...in triplicate!And I don't care if it's raining, there better not be a single smudge on 'em!Now quit dragging your behinds and move! Move, I say!!!
1�<Mumble, grumble>(Gimme a break, already..
.)�Sergeant Rainer, sir!
1�Hm? I don't recall being on a first-name basis with no snot-nosed sissy boys.
1�Er, Nicolaus of Company Skink, sir.This is my comrade Five Moons.
1�And this is  .Together, we're investigating the disappearance of your man Zeid.
1�...And doing a bloody poor job, from the looks of it!If you're going to find him, find him and quit wasting my time!And remember--if he puts up a fight, there's no need to bring him back alive.

1�Y-yes, of course, sir.We just thought we might better perform our duty if you could share with us some information.Any conspicuous changes in Zeid's behavior since he joined your esteemed unit, for exam--
1�His behavior? He's a bloody Galka, what do you think his ��behavior�� is!?
1�He stands around sulking and brooding like he's got the weight of the whole world on his shoulders!Bah! What does that fool know about responsibility!?
1�I've got myself a whole squad full of these louts to look after, and you don't see me complainin'!
1�You over there! Slacking on duty, are we
